Skip v8+ modules when WANT_PI4=0

Sanity check contents of updated rpi-update

See: https://github.com/Hexxeh/rpi-update/issues/285

Allow disabling the partition check logic (#283)

If you're running this script in a chroot on a server (NFSROOT), then
the partition check logic will fail.
Fix wildcard that missed start.elf/fixup.dat

Add support for Pi4 and warnings for dangerous updates

WANT_PI4=1 allows update from a Pi3 system but should be
used with caution.
Small refactoring and tidyups (#279)
Tweak wording in README (#278)
Update readme to warn about pi-hole

This reverts commit b431ad7cac827507c5925b5aa3273c4e8bdeb1c7.

This reverts commit f2493af31dad6afde55948c6d93c326e98e73da5.
Add quoting around -w option of curl

Added RPI_REBOOT=1 expert option description. (#264)

Add RPI_REBOOT option

See: https://github.com/Hexxeh/rpi-update/issues/263

Avoid exiting early when parsing git hash

See: https://github.com/Hexxeh/rpi-update/issues/245
Avoid using gnu specific strtonum
Include a specific check for github API limit being hit
With JUST_CHECK indicate when firmware is being downgraded

Convert to long hashes before comparing with last hash from file

See: https://github.com/Hexxeh/rpi-update/issues/243

Imply SKIP_KERNEL=1 when custom kernel file name is set (#235)

Skip installation of kernel and .dtb files if the user has a
custom kernel.

Prevents users ending up with a bricked system that hangs on
rainbow screen, because the 4.9.x .dtb files do not work
with a 4.4.x custom kernel.

Signed-off-by: Floris Bos <bos@je-eigen-domein.nl>

Check for HTTP error codes >= 400 when updating rpi-update
See: https://github.com/Hexxeh/rpi-update/issues/228
Updated readme to clarify use on non-raspbian distributions is not advised

Merge pull request #147 from ghollingworth/patch-1

Stop rpi-update deleting dt-blob.bin

Stop rpi-update deleting dt-blob.bin

dt-blob.bin is used to configure a platform's pin settings and clock settings and must not be changed when we do an rpi-update.  This is a function of the platform rather than a function of the operating system and therefore shouldn't be removed
Update url to githubusercontent

Merge pull request #144 from kcl-lescalan/patch-1

Update README.md

Update README.md

Upon installation of the tool, the command executed writes rpi-update to /usr/bin detailing a 301 error, indicating the source of the update has changed to https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Hexxeh/rpi-update/master/rpi-update. This address change has been reflected in the proposed file change.

Merge pull request #139 from lurch/patch-1

Small header tidyup
Small header tidyup

Support install from local repo.

See: https://github.com/Hexxeh/rpi-update/issues/134
cosmetic: Make use the REPO_API variable
Update readme for latest version of rpi-update

Download firmware without using git

This removes the requirement for git. We never make use of partial git updates,
and it is quicker to download the tarball with curl than use git.

Also piping the curl output into tar is quicker than downloading then un-tarring.

Remove the verbose options from the copies (they don't fail, slow down the copies
and swamp any more useful output messages).

By default delete /root/.rpi_firmware (as it's easy to recreate). Use
SKIP_REPODELETE=1 if you want to keep it.

Add option SKIP_BACKUP=1 if you don't want a backup of old firmware and modules.

Switch from wget to curl for downloads

May solve issues like https://github.com/Hexxeh/rpi-update/issues/65

Merge pull request #85 from leucos/fix-#84

Updates .firmware_revision when revision set at CLI

Updates .firmware_revision when revision set at CLI

When revision was specified at the command line,
$FW_PATH/.firmware_updating wasn't updated to reflect the change.
Now $FW_PATH/.firmware_updating is always updated, so idempotency is
achieved when using revision Id's at the command line.
Fixes #84
